snippet: The accounts of an Egyptian who lawyers said had most likely been tortured were unreliable, the defense counsel of a former Brooklyn man said.
abstract: Prosecutors in federal court in Manhattan want to use a detainee’s claims about Sabirhan Hasanoff’s role in assisting Al Qaeda as part of argument that he should receive maximum 20-year prison sentence; his lawyers contend the statements are unreliable, in part because Hasanoff was quite likely tortured while in foreign custody before he met with Federal Bureau of Investigation.
lead_paragraph: The accounts of an Egyptian who lawyers said had most likely been tortured were unreliable, the defense counsel of a former Brooklyn man said.

headline.seo: Statements by Detained Egyptian Terrorism Suspect Are Focus of Sentencing
headline.main: Statements by Detained Terror Suspect Are Focus of Sentencing, and of Debate
headline.print_headline: Statements to F.B.I. by Detained Terror Suspect Are a Focus at Another Man’s Sentencing
